cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 325 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest toward the northwest Bahamas, then turning west-northwest to cross the Florida Peninsula, emerging over central/northern Florida and into southern Georgia before curving north-northeast up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the east coast of Florida near or just north of West Palm Beach (Boca Raton–Port St. Lucie area)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch (also Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to the Ochlockonee River, FL (west coast of Florida, including Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for west-coast Florida; hurricane and storm-surge warnings confined to the Atlantic side
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, especially the east coast, with tropical-storm impacts extending across central Florida to the Gulf Coast (Englewood–Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible at Port Manatee with a peak 53 % chance; gusts could reach 50–60 mph Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible in Tampa Bay, including the Port Manatee waterfront, especially Thursday during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 8 inches could fall across west-central Florida, producing flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous marine conditions (large waves, rip currents) likely Thursday.
